formattedAddress: 385 Broome St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 385 Broome St, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: Quaint bakery serving housemade gelato & other Italian treats like cannoli & tiramisu since 1891.

originalText.text: Had a fantastic experience here yesterday. We had affogato, cookies and tiramaso and it was all delicious. I love that it authentically feels like a family Italian cafe, each item made in house. Also, very inexpensive for quality of the items. Very happy we popped in here! Thank you!

text.text: Had a fantastic experience here yesterday. We had affogato, cookies and tiramaso and it was all delicious. I love that it authentically feels like a family Italian cafe, each item made in house. Also, very inexpensive for quality of the items. Very happy we popped in here! Thank you!

originalText.text: I had a wonderful experience here! It was such a cozy, quaint spot. The service was wonderful. We had the Sicilian cannolis and they were absolutely delicious. The cappuccino was delicious as well.

text.text: I had a wonderful experience here! It was such a cozy, quaint spot. The service was wonderful. We had the Sicilian cannolis and they were absolutely delicious. The cappuccino was delicious as well.

originalText.text: Nice historic cafe in little Italy to pop into for a post meal espresso + dessert. We got some Italian cheesecake, which was light and came with candied orange peels.

text.text: Nice historic cafe in little Italy to pop into for a post meal espresso + dessert. We got some Italian cheesecake, which was light and came with candied orange peels.

originalText.text: 4/14/2023, Friday:  A historic cafe with excellent cookies and pastries (and I'm sure fine gelato and coffee & tea) founded year 1891 on the corner of Mulberry St and Broome St in Little Italy.  I tried the dark chocolate covered cannolis, which are considered among the best in NYC, and they were authentic and delicious and hold to their reputation.  The inside decor is very historic and elegant, especially compared to new contemporary cafes.  All of the Italian pastries and biscotti  are very well organized and labeled, and the staff is very welcoming and friendly.  A great place to stop by in Little Italy near Soho, Chinatown, and the LES.

text.text: 4/14/2023, Friday:  A historic cafe with excellent cookies and pastries (and I'm sure fine gelato and coffee & tea) founded year 1891 on the corner of Mulberry St and Broome St in Little Italy.  I tried the dark chocolate covered cannolis, which are considered among the best in NYC, and they were authentic and delicious and hold to their reputation.  The inside decor is very historic and elegant, especially compared to new contemporary cafes.  All of the Italian pastries and biscotti  are very well organized and labeled, and the staff is very welcoming and friendly.  A great place to stop by in Little Italy near Soho, Chinatown, and the LES.

originalText.text: My mom and I were visiting NYC for the first time and wanted some pastries and desserts down in Little Italy. We decided this place looked cute and yummy. We walked in and no greeting what so ever! We stand there and stand there. The tall, dark haired girl never acknowledges us. She is walking around looking at tables and helping others. Next thing a group comes in behind us and she comes up and ask if they would like to sit. Literally standing right next to us. Still no acknowledgement. Have you seen the movie Ghost? Well that is how my mom and I felt, like we were just ghost in the building watching all the others move around and get waited on. FINALLY my mom says something and the girl comes over and we start telling her what we wanted and she gets the cherry cheesecake my mom asked for out on a plate and puts it on the counter. I start telling her what I would like and this blonde woman (not sure if it’s the owner or manager) comes over and tells the tall girl her teas were ready and she needs to take them to the table. As the blonde lady walks away she looks at us and says she is going to have to take her drinks to a table and will be right back. I was done at this point and we just walked out. All I can say is this was the rudest people! Never have I ever experienced such rudeness in the food industry as a customer. God Bless both of their little hearts.
